channel.title: ascidians on I'm a Chordata! Urochordata!
channel.description: Recent content in ascidians on I'm a Chordata! Urochordata!

item.title: Dramatic Predator Tunicate is Dramatic
item.description: Another fun video via Chris Mah! It’s a trap!

item.title: Predatory Tunicate Art
item.description: To bring the blog back to its tunicate-y roots, here’s an AWESOME piece of predatory tunicate art from Noctorunal Sea. They say they’ll have it up as at this webstore soon. I know what I’m gettin’ for my office wall next! [caption id="attachment_1163” align="aligncenter” width="451” caption="Predatory tunicate art by Nocturnal sea. Go visit their webstore (link above) and buy some of their awesome ocean and ecology art!"][/caption]

item.title: Vicious Predator of the Deep!
item.description: Thanks to Chris Mah for sending me over to this great video of a fearsome predatory tunicate (likely Megalodicopia hians)! Happy Friday, all!

item.title: Tunicate Whiskey
item.description: From this issue of the Ascidian News comes word of something….well….awesome. Tunicate Whiskey. To wit, hollow out one Halocynthia roretzi. Fill tunic with Soju (korean whiskey). Drink. For some reason, I think this would work really well with Laphroaig or other Islay malts. Or, perhaps, give that nice Islay character to something more generic - spice up your Johnny walker with a little Styela. On second thought, a big Styela is about the size of a shot glass…

item.title: Tunicates on Bizarre Foods!
item.description: At last, Halocynthia roretzi has made it to the Food Network! Scroll to 3:40 for the good stuff. “Yummy is not the word I would use to describe this…” Uh oh.

item.title: Ascidians in Vanity Fair!
item.description: Yes, it’s time for squirts to take the limelight in America’s most fashionable magazine! I know this is a little old, but in the 2007 article, If You Knew Sushi by Nick Tosches, the author encounters a delicacy, Halocynthia roretzi aka the Sea Pineapple. (That’s right, they’re even on wikipedia now!) Among a biochromatic wealth of mysterious mollusks and other sea invertebrates of unknown nature, I see the weirdest creature I've ever seen.
